hero.title: Justin Klitgaard
hero.content: Fullstack software developer in Tokyo, Japan

blurb: Welcome to my personal site. As mentioned above, I'm a fullstack software developer living and working in Tokyo. Check out my projects, tech stack, and contact info below. You can learn a little more about me in the About Me page.

japanEvents.title: Japan Events
japanEvents.description: An app that indexes events from around Japan and let's users find them with a rich search interface, save interesting events, and anonymously share them.

recipeWrangler.title: Recipe Wrangler
recipeWrangler.description: Allows users to search for recipes, creates check lists for ingredients and cooking directions. Logged in users can also save recipes and create their own.

washokuWalker.title: Washoku Walker
washokuWalker.description: Helps users find great restaurants in Japan. Users who want to find a specific food can get a selection of restaurants by dish and area, or get a list of highly-rated restaurants near them.

personalSite.title: Personal Site (this site)
personalSite.description: My personal site for sharing my projects, tech stack and info about me.

courseManagment.title: Course Managment
courseManagment.description: A fullstack learning management system that allows users to create, read, update, and delete information about courses, instructors, and students.

pokemonMemory.title: Nagano Quest
pokemonMemory.description: A fun little choose your own adventure game that takes users through Nagano Prefecture, Japan.

aboutMe.para1: I'm a fullstack software developer living and working in Japan.
aboutMe.para2: I first came to Japan as an English teacher in Nagano Prefecture, and then transitioned to developing content for standardized English tests at Benesse, the largest educational company in Japan. While there, I had the opportunity to work on a couple of AI-powered English testing apps, where I was responsible for developing standards for the scoring system and gathering and preparing training data for deep learning models. I was also responsible for coordinating (and translating for) our Japanese team at Benesse, partner development companies in Japan, and data scientists in India.
aboutMe.para3: This involved using Excel a lot (where I learned to appreciate the power of the function, a good intro to programming in itself), and got me interested in software development in general. I ended up teaching myself Python and was able to automate some work, and then got interested in web development. I learned a lot about fullstack JavaScript development at The Odin Project, and then decided to challenge myself even further by joining a full-time, intensive programming bootcamp at Tokyo's Code Chrysalis.
aboutMe.para4: It was a tough four months (about one month for the online precourse, and three for the on-site immersive course), but I came out able to develop fullstack applications both autonomously and on a team. I also learned a lot about testing and agile workflows (especially when I lead the development of my group's final project, a big learning experience itself).
aboutMe.inSum: I love programming, learning new things, and challenging myself. Feel free to reach out to me below.

odin.description: A great, open source place to learn about web development in depth.

CC.description: A programming bootcamp based in Tokyo (sadly no longer doing BtoC courses and focusing on corporate clients!).
